info.game_comments:
Jack Archey game 3.
 The last Jeopardy! show of the 1900s.

double_jeopardy_round: IT'S NOT THE END OF THE WORLD

(1, 1).clue: On Valentine's Day 2000, the Near spacecraft is due to begin orbiting this asteroid named for the Greek god of love

(2, 1).clue: This fox from "Melrose Place" has joined Michael J. on "Spin City"

(3, 1).clue: Located on the Thames River, it's been Europe's largest city since around 1700

(4, 1).clue: This lovely letter-turner got her turn at playing Venus in the 1988 TV movie "Goddess of Love"

(5, 1).clue: This actor's dad James Broderick played the dad on TV's "Family"

(6, 1).clue: In this 1987 film, Cher is engaged to marry an older man, Danny Aiello, but falls in love with Nicolas Cage

(1, 2).clue: One of the more impressive meteor showers comes in December from this constellation of the twins

(2, 2).clue: Now in her second year as "Jesse", she was Kelly Bundy for 11 seasons

(3, 2).clue: According to tradition, tossing a coin into this city's Trevi Fountain ensures a return visit

(4, 2).clue: In 1999 she & her sister Serena aced the women's doubles final at the French Open

(5, 2).clue: Former president Bush must be proud -- his sons George W. & Jeb govern these 2 states

(6, 2).clue: This Jackie Gleason series began as a sketch on Dumont's "Cavalcade of Stars" in the '50s

(1, 3).clue: In 1994 fragments of Shoemaker-Levy 9 struck this planet, creating a plume over 1,000 miles high

(2, 3).clue: Albert Brooks cast her as "The Muse"

(3, 3).clue: This Costa Rican capital's international airport is named for 19th century hero Juan Santamaria

(4, 3).clue: In 1986 this female trio put "Venus" on top of the music charts

(2, 4).clue: She was the first VJ to appear on both MTV & MTV Latino

(3, 4).clue: In the 1980s Nicolae Ceausescu built this city's Palace of the People

(4, 4).clue: Before residing at the Louvre, this famous Greek statue belonged to Louis XVIII

(5, 4).clue: This famous son gave his name to a Dearborn, Michigan high school & a car flop of the 1950s

(6, 4).clue: In 1971 this Who drummer appeared as a nun in Frank Zappa's film "200 Motels"

(1, 5).clue: According to one of this German's laws of motion, planets travel faster when they are closer to the sun

(2, 5).clue: A TV Guide "You Sexy Thing!" poll pitted Jeri Ryan of "Star Trek: Voyager" against this show's Peta Wilson

(4, 5).correct response: Men are from Mars, Women are from Venus

(5, 5).clue: In 2 Samuel David laments for him, "My son, my son...would God I had died for thee"

(6, 5).clue: The French title of this 1865 Jules Verne classic is "De la Terre a la Lune"
(6, 5).correct response: From the Earth to the Moon

(1, 1).clue: In the deal of the century, the U.S. made this $15 million purchase & doubled the size of the U.S.

(2, 1).clue: As a rule, rose stems should be cut above a group of 5 of these

(3, 1).clue: They thrived in the scorching heat of the California desert that bears their name

(5, 1).clue: This 1972 Woody Allen film included clips & music from "Casablanca", sweetheart

(2, 2).clue: A verb meaning to remove withered roses, or a noun meaning a fan of a Jerry Garcia band

(3, 2).clue: Add 1 letter to "Iowa" to get the name of this tribe who lived south of the Iowa
